Palette Picker

VP - dreamRs

25 mars 2017

Construct a palette picker with function pickerInput from package shinyWidgets (and a bit of CSS). Palettes are those available in RColorBrewer.


The plot is taken from Spring Shapes by Yan Holtz (R Graph Gallery).

How it works ?

First get all palettes available by category :

# List of palettes
colors_pal <- lapply(
  X = split(
    x = brewer.pal.info,
    f = factor(brewer.pal.info$category, labels = c("Diverging", "Qualitative", "Sequential"))
  ),
  FUN = rownames
)
colors_pal
## $Diverging
## [1] "BrBG"     "PiYG"     "PRGn"     "PuOr"     "RdBu"     "RdGy"    
## [7] "RdYlBu"   "RdYlGn"   "Spectral"
## 
## $Qualitative
## [1] "Accent"  "Dark2"   "Paired"  "Pastel1" "Pastel2" "Set1"    "Set2"   
## [8] "Set3"   
## 
## $Sequential
##  [1] "Blues"   "BuGn"    "BuPu"    "GnBu"    "Greens"  "Greys"   "Oranges"
##  [8] "OrRd"    "PuBu"    "PuBuGn"  "PuRd"    "Purples" "RdPu"    "Reds"   
## [15] "YlGn"    "YlGnBu"  "YlOrBr"  "YlOrRd"

Then get all colors in each palette :

# Get all colors given a palette name(s)
get_brewer_name <- function(name) {
  pals <- brewer.pal.info[rownames(brewer.pal.info) %in% name, ]
  res <- lapply(
    X = seq_len(nrow(pals)),
    FUN = function(i) {
      brewer.pal(n = pals$maxcolors[i], name = rownames(pals)[i])
    }
  )
  unlist(res)
}

background_pals <- sapply(unlist(colors_pal, use.names = FALSE), get_brewer_name)
head(background_pals, 3)
## $BrBG
##  [1] "#543005" "#8C510A" "#BF812D" "#DFC27D" "#F6E8C3" "#F5F5F5" "#C7EAE5"
##  [8] "#80CDC1" "#35978F" "#01665E" "#003C30"
## 
## $PiYG
##  [1] "#8E0152" "#C51B7D" "#DE77AE" "#F1B6DA" "#FDE0EF" "#F7F7F7" "#E6F5D0"
##  [8] "#B8E186" "#7FBC41" "#4D9221" "#276419"
## 
## $PRGn
##  [1] "#40004B" "#762A83" "#9970AB" "#C2A5CF" "#E7D4E8" "#F7F7F7" "#D9F0D3"
##  [8] "#A6DBA0" "#5AAE61" "#1B7837" "#00441B"

With a pal, construct a linear gradient (in CSS, explanation here) :

# Calc linear gradient for CSS
linear_gradient <- function(cols) {
  x <- round(seq(from = 0, to = 100, length.out = length(cols)+1))
  ind <- c(1, rep(seq_along(x)[-c(1, length(x))], each = 2), length(x))
  m <- matrix(data = paste0(x[ind], "%"), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
  res <- lapply(
    X = seq_len(nrow(m)),
    FUN = function(i) {
      paste(paste(cols[i], m[i, 1]), paste(cols[i], m[i, 2]), sep = ", ")
    }
  )
  res <- unlist(res)
  res <- paste(res, collapse = ", ")
  paste0("linear-gradient(to right, ", res, ");")
}

background_pals <- unlist(lapply(X = background_pals, FUN = linear_gradient))
head(background_pals, 3)
##                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     BrBG 
## "linear-gradient(to right, #543005 0%, #543005 9%, #8C510A 9%, #8C510A 18%, #BF812D 18%, #BF812D 27%, #DFC27D 27%, #DFC27D 36%, #F6E8C3 36%, #F6E8C3 45%, #F5F5F5 45%, #F5F5F5 55%, #C7EAE5 55%, #C7EAE5 64%, #80CDC1 64%, #80CDC1 73%, #35978F 73%, #35978F 82%, #01665E 82%, #01665E 91%, #003C30 91%, #003C30 100%);" 
##                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     PiYG 
## "linear-gradient(to right, #8E0152 0%, #8E0152 9%, #C51B7D 9%, #C51B7D 18%, #DE77AE 18%, #DE77AE 27%, #F1B6DA 27%, #F1B6DA 36%, #FDE0EF 36%, #FDE0EF 45%, #F7F7F7 45%, #F7F7F7 55%, #E6F5D0 55%, #E6F5D0 64%, #B8E186 64%, #B8E186 73%, #7FBC41 73%, #7FBC41 82%, #4D9221 82%, #4D9221 91%, #276419 91%, #276419 100%);" 
##                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     PRGn 
## "linear-gradient(to right, #40004B 0%, #40004B 9%, #762A83 9%, #762A83 18%, #9970AB 18%, #9970AB 27%, #C2A5CF 27%, #C2A5CF 36%, #E7D4E8 36%, #E7D4E8 45%, #F7F7F7 45%, #F7F7F7 55%, #D9F0D3 55%, #D9F0D3 64%, #A6DBA0 64%, #A6DBA0 73%, #5AAE61 73%, #5AAE61 82%, #1B7837 82%, #1B7837 91%, #00441B 91%, #00441B 100%);"

Set the text color (white for Diverging pals, black overwise) :

colortext_pals <- rep(c("white", "black", "black"), times = sapply(colors_pal, length))

And now you can pass colors to pickerInput :

pickerInput(
  inputId = "col_palette", label = "Choose a palette :",
  choices = colors_pal, selected = "Paired", width = "50%",
  choicesOpt = list(
    content = sprintf(
      "<div style='width:100%%;padding:5px;border-radius:4px;background:%s;color:%s'>%s</div>",
      unname(background_pals), colortext_pals, names(background_pals)
    )
  )
)
